result.execSummary:
The defendant Arne J Bast was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arne J Bast

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arne J Bast in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED her/his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds Remotely. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

Pay Fine in the amount of $1000.00 Plus cost, fees  and surcharges  by 12 MONTHS or Civil Judgment. 
Court waived all non mandatory and mandatory  Costs  except DNA surcharge due to inability to pay. 
Provide DNA specimen on or before June 13th, 2022 or face additional penalties and pay DNA surcharge.
Appellate Rights given.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Elements of the Offense/  WIS JI - Criminal

Defendant Arne J Bast in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arne J Bast appeared by video means with Attorney.    
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held as to the posture of the case.  Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Arne J Bast in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

ADDRESS INFO for Arne J Bast
Current: 1505 North Franklin Place #602, Milwaukee, WI 53202   (Effective: 03-09-2022)
Prior: 1505 North Franklin Place #708, Milwaukee, WI 53202

Defendant Arne J Bast in court with Attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019835,
Payable Number: 988925,
Receipt Number: 22RP008336,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 2p
